title: Uber’s Sexual Assault Problem, and ICE’s $50,000 Signing Bonus
summary: Plus, the shark bite club.

title: RFK Jr. Cancels Nearly $500 Million in mRNA Vaccine Contracts
summary: That kind of shot was first used during the Covid-19 pandemic, but the health secretary has been sharply critical of the technology.

title: Kennedy’s Crusade Against Food Safety Rule Threatens Supplement Industry
summary: By going after an obscure regulatory designation he describes as a “loophole,” Mr. Kennedy has put an industry he champions on the defensive.

title: Why the B.L.S. Regularly Revises Jobs Data
summary: President Trump fired the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics last week and described a jobs report that included a big downward revision as “rigged.”

title: For Some Wounded in Ukraine War, Surgery Helps Rebuild a Sense of Self
summary: Surgeons have made significant strides in tending to the war’s wounded, particularly through the use of 3-D printing, creating patient-specific implants and surgical guides.

title: War Shattered His Face. Technology Helped Reconstruct It.
summary: Volodymyr is a Ukrainian marksman whose face was shattered by a Russian bomb in 2023. After multiple surgeries and titanium implants, he has returned to active duty near the closest point of the front line of the war with Russia. Calling in from there, he describes his recovery to Marc Santora, an international editor for The New York Times.

title: The ‘Hamilton’ Effect: 10 Revolutionary Years on Broadway
summary: Lin-Manuel Miranda’s much-loved musical opened on Broadway a decade ago, ushering in a new era of race-conscious casting, audience outreach and even stardom.

title: How One Company Maintained a Monopoly on U.S. Fire Retardant
summary: Perimeter Solutions sought to undercut rivals, leaving federal officials worried about their reliance on a single company for a crucial product.

title: Wildfire In Wet Washington State Is Changing Under Climate Change
summary: The famously rainy state is facing longer, hotter and drier fire seasons, raising the risk of a mammoth fire that will be nearly impossible to fight. All the state can do is prepare.

title: Dragon Bravo Fire at Grand Canyon Spreads to More Than 126,000 Acres
summary: The Dragon Bravo fire has been burning for more than a month, fueled by record-low humidity that has hampered containment efforts.

title: 3 Years Before Midtown Manhattan Shooting, Nevada Police Had Gunman Committed
summary: The Las Vegas police released documents and records describing the mental health breakdowns that the man who killed four people in a New York building had faced earlier.

title: Truce Quiets Syrian City Torn by Sectarian Clashes
summary: The fighting has stopped in the southern city of Sweida, three weeks after a deadly eruption of violence. But the area remains tense as clashes continue beyond the city.

title: Cuomo Calls for Gaza Aid and Says ‘Some People’ Blame Israel for Crisis
summary: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo appeared to criticize Israel over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. Hours later, he distanced himself from his remarks.

title: British Opera Company Cancels ‘Tosca’ Collaboration in Israel After Criticism
summary: The Royal Ballet and Opera said it was scrapping performances in Tel Aviv next year, after nearly 200 staff members signed an open letter criticizing its stance on the war in Gaza.

title: China Is a Nation of Savers. Many Are Drowning in Debt.
summary: As Beijing pushes consumer lending to stimulate the economy, millions of Chinese borrowers, especially the young, are falling into debt spirals.

title: Video Forces Pakistan to Confront ‘Honor Killings’ and Gender Violence
summary: Women in Pakistan die every day for supposedly dishonoring their families, and arrests are rare. But Bano Bibi’s defiant last words were caught on video.

title: At the Tesla Diner, the Future Looks Mid
summary: The new Los Angeles restaurant from the electric car giant is a smash burger and content machine, drawing Elon Musk’s fans and protesters.

title: Eighty Years of Nuclear Weapons Is Enough
summary: The nuclear taboo is on the verge of collapse.

title: Senator Mark Kelly: Don’t Gut NASA
summary: Before he was a senator, Mark Kelly was an astronaut. He’s worried about America’s leadership in space.

title: Raucous Town Halls
summary: We explore the new political danger of a centuries-old format.

title: Stephen Colbert Says Trump’s ‘Big Beautiful Bill’ Could Cost the G.O.P. Its Popularity
summary: “When they learned that, Republicans immediately saw the light, sprang into action, promised to tax the rich and restore people’s health care,” he joked.

title: Legionnaires’ Outbreak in Harlem Kills 2 and Sickens More Than 50
summary: The source of the illness has not been conclusively identified more than a week after people began getting sick.

title: NFL Will Get a Stake in ESPN in a Complex Deal
summary: A day after announcing the N.F.L.’s ownership stake in its sports network, Disney reported a 16 percent increase in adjusted per-share profit.

title: Sudan’s Civil War Shifts Toward Kordofan
summary: Since the Sudanese Army drove its paramilitary rival from the capital in March, the two sides are battling for territorial gains in the Kordofan region.

title: Italy Approves Project to Link Sicily to the Mainland by Bridge
summary: The government says the road and rail link will create jobs and lift the economy of the region, but critics are concerned about the environmental and social impact.
